organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: MRI-guided thrOmbolysis for Stroke bEyond Time Window by TNK
identificationModule.officialTitle: MRI-guided thrOmbolysis for Stroke bEyond Time Window by TNK (ROSE-TNK): a Prospective, Randomized, Blinded Assessment of Outcome and Open Label Multi-center Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is an open label multicentre trial, evaluating the utility of MRI-guided thrombolysis for stroke beyond time window by Tenecteplase (TNK-tPA). This exploratory study was to describe the feasibility and outcome of thrombolytic therapy with TNK-tPA in 4.5-24 hours after stroke guided by a mismatch between diffusion-weighted imaging and FLAIR in the region of ischemia.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: In patients with acute stroke with an unknown time of onset, intravenous alteplase guided by a mismatch between diffusion-weighted imaging and FLAIR in the region of ischemia resulted in a significantly better functional outcome at 90 days. This trial will enroll acute ischemic stroke patients within 4.5 to 24 hours of onset. All the patients had an ischemic lesion that was visible on MRI diffusion-weighted imaging but no parenchymal hyperintensity on fluid-attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR), which indicated that the stroke had a ischemic penumbra. Randomization will be 1:1 to TNK-tPA (experimental) or standard treatment (control), in compliance with guidelines for acute stroke. Clinical outcome was assessed by disability on the basis of the modified Rankin scale at 90 days follow-up, which will be performed by a blinded assessor.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The Outcomes will be performed by a blinded assessor.

armGroups.label: TNK-tPA
armGroups.description: TNK-tPA (0.25mg/kg) given as a single bolus over 5-10 seconds immediately upon randomization.

armGroups.label: Routine Therapy
armGroups.description: Patients will be treated with standard of care in compliance with guidelines for acute stroke

interventions.name: Tenecteplase
interventions.description: The participants received TNK-tPA thrombolytic therapy

primaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Distribution of the modified Rankin Scale (mRS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of NIHSS are 42 and 0, respectively; higher NIHSS mean a worse outcome
The incidence of stroke and other vascular events

otherOutcomes.description: sICH was defined as 4 or more increase in NIHSS caused by hemorrhage

otherOutcomes.measure: Proportion of intraparenchymal hemorrhage (PH1 and PH2)
otherOutcomes.description: Proportion of PH1 and PH2 within 48 hours after the treatment
